title: History of Italy (1559–1814)
summary: Following the Peace of Cateau Cambrésis, France renounced its claims in the Duchy of Milan and on the Spanish viceroyalties of the Mezzogiorno. Some of the Italian states were under the rule of powerful dynasties: the Medici in Tuscany, the Farnese in Parma, the Este in Modena, and the Savoy in Piedmont. While the southern kingdoms of Naples, Sicily and Sardinia were under the direct rule of the Spanish Empire.[1][2]
